introText: The Ministry of Infrastructure manages government facilities, infrastructure planning, and public-private partnerships, supporting the physical foundations of government services and economic development.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of Infrastructure spent $2.6B in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 1.3% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports government facilities, infrastructure projects, and community development.
roleText: Infrastructure is the backbone of government service delivery and economic development. This ministry manages government real estate, coordinates major infrastructure projects, and supports community infrastructure development.
programsDescription: The Ministry of Infrastructure operates programs including government real estate management, infrastructure planning, broadband development, municipal infrastructure support, and public-private partnership oversight.
